headline: Meet the Only S&P 500 Stock That Yields Over 10%. Here's Why It Could Be Worth Buying in June.
summary: Commodity chemical giant Dow Inc. (NYSE: DOW) is hovering around a five-year low and is now down around 50% from its spin-off price when DowDuPont split into three separate companies in April 2019.  Dow has kept its dividend the same for the last six years.  Here's why Dow's challenges persist and why the dividend stock could be worth buying now, even if the company reduces its payout.
